page.title: 07BROADLANDS LAKE
page.content: When the M.27 was planned across the Hampshire countyside,gravel had to be extracted to make concrete,one site chosen was on the proposed route near the River Test.{The flooding of the {pits in 1975 with water from the river {created Broadlands a coarse fishing {lake on the estate of Lord Romsey.}The lake was opened to the first fishermen in 1977.{It covers an area of {approximately 11 acres and is 13 feet {deep at it's deepest point,}many millions of fish start life in the lake,they include Carp,Mirror Carp, Tench,Bream,Roach and Pike.The largest fish caught to date has been a Pike of {39 lbs 4 ozs},12 ozs short of the British record.{Fishing cost Â£2.70 a {day Â£1.35 for a junior under the age {of 16.}In the summer months 300 to 400 people come to fish every week,Sunday being the busiest day.
